What is a public record?

Public records are documents created or retained by a government. If it came in contact with a government employee or government money at any point, it's probably a public record.

The types of records below can all be requested through FOIA.

  • Emails & texts
  • Telephone logs
  • Contracts
  • Photographs
  • Meeting minutes
  • Algorithms
  • Training materials
  • Receipts
  • Calendars
  • Notes & memoranda
  • Surveillance footage
  • Reports
  • Salaries
  • Military records
  • FBI files

A decade of FOIA requests

In 2018, the federal government received a record high number of requests.

Source: U.S. Department of Justice

Top-requested agencies

The vast majority of requests go to a small handful of agencies. The Department of Homeland Security and its myriad components received 46% of all FOIA requests filed in 2018.

Source: MuckRock | data collected November 24, 2019
